definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
person being executed/victim of corporal punishment/person serving a sentence

sentences.english: He took off his coat to cover the criminal's body.
sentences.chinese: 他立刻解下身上的外套，覆盖在受刑人的尸体上。

sentences.english: The victim was then partially immersed in the liquid and fried to death.
sentences.chinese: 受刑人会部分被浸在液体中被煎炸而死。

sentences.english: This paper studies the protection of the rights of criminals, is divided into three parts.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究受刑人权利的保护，共分为三部分。

sentences.english: The tormentors could hammer at least a dozen wedges up and down the legs.
sentences.chinese: 每个受刑之人的腿上至少都会被敲进一打这种楔形物。

sentences.english: Gravity and the victim’s own struggles would cause him to slide down the pole.
sentences.chinese: 重力和受刑人自己的挣扎将导致他滑下棍子。

sentences.english: At midday, criminals were put to death.
sentences.chinese: 日正当中，罪犯受刑处死。

sentences.english: He drew on his experience as a teacher in order to get close to the young inmates.
sentences.chinese: 他利用过去当老师的经验来亲近这些年轻的受刑人。

sentences.english: In its second "proof" the exact date is revealed by working forward from the exact date of the of the crucifixion - April 1, 33 AD.
sentences.chinese: 第二个“证据”可由耶稣受刑的日期延伸出来。

sentences.english: She accompanied him in Galilee, and she witnessed his crucifixion and burial.
sentences.chinese: 她陪同耶稣到加利利，目睹了他受刑和被埋葬的过程。

definition: beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
